meanings.definition: The highest or climactic point of something, especially as reached after a long period of time.
meanings.sent1: The culmination of the play was the final scene where the hero defeated the villain.
meanings.sent2: The project's culmination was the successful launch of the new product.
meanings.sent3: The culmination of the party was when the cake fell on the floor, creating a messy but funny moment.
meanings.sent4: The culmination of her journey was standing at the mountain peak, feeling on top of the world.
meanings.sent5: The culmination of the race was the last sprint to the finish line, with everyone cheering loudly.

meanings.definition: The act of reaching the highest point or climax.
meanings.sent1: Her hard work led to the culmination of her dream to become a doctor.
meanings.sent2: The team celebrated the culmination of their efforts with a well-deserved party.
meanings.sent3: The culmination of the dance performance was a surprise flash mob that delighted the audience.
meanings.sent4: The culmination of the movie was the unexpected plot twist that left everyone in awe.
meanings.sent5: The culmination of the concert was the encore performance that left the crowd roaring for more.
